data.text: @COVID19actuary @ActuaryByDay @john_actuary @longevitymatt @DanRyanCoios @AdeleGroyer @lrossouw Non merci, après 2 ans de stress suite à tout le "FEAR PORN" publié par les journalistes et "experts".Ma famille et moi venons de terminer la quarantaine et je vous jure que ce virus est la chose la plus surévalué depuis Alexandre Daigle...Une vrai farce 4 cas + et un mal d gorge
@fascinatorfun @COVID19actuary @lrossouw Flat. 114 in w/e 4 March compared to 113 in w/e 25 February.

@COVID19actuary @ActuaryByDay @lrossouw Do you have the Care Home Covid related deaths for comparison?

Down or up?
Lastly, COVID deaths in English hospitals are still falling. After adjusting for estimated reporting delays, hospital deaths have fallen by 5% week-on-week.   5/5 https://t.co/erqOiKsPs7

Bed occupied by COVID patients are also increasing again, up 10% week-on-week. Mechanical Ventilation beds occupied are still falling through, down 6%.

Tomorrow we’ll have an updated breakdown between patients where COVID is the primary diagnosis and those where it isn’t.  4/5 https://t.co/H3DujutUDY

All age groups are seeing rapid increases in hospital admissions with COVID. The older groups began increasing first, leading to speculation that the increase was driven by waning immunity, but younger groups have now followed.  3/5 https://t.co/AlOstbe3SQ

Admissions are up sharply in most English regions. The most rapid increase is in the South West, up 35%. Only NE & Yorks has seen a small fall (down 1%). Other regions are up by between 17% and 28%.  2/5 https://t.co/ccOziiFJhH
